sen.j: 蘇我 娼子（そがのしょうし／そがのまさこ、生没年未詳）は飛鳥時代後期の蘇我氏の女性。
sen.e: SOGA no Shoshi, or SOGA no Masako (the date of birth and death unknown) was a woman of the Soga clan in the late Asuka period.
SOGA no Shoshi, or SOGA no Masako (the date of birth and death unknown) was a woman of the Soga clan in the late Asuka period.
SOGA no Shoshi, or SOGA no Masako (the date of birth and death unknown) was a woman of the Soga clan in the late Asuka period.

sen.j: 「娼子」という名前は『尊卑分脈』に依る物で、『公卿補任』では蘇我 媼子（そがのおんし／そがのおうなこ）と書かれている。
sen.e: Her name, Shoshi, is seen in "Sonpibunmyaku" (Japanese genealogical text), while in "Kugyobunin" (directory of court nobles), her name was written as SOGA no Onshi, or SOGA no Ounako.

sen.j: 天武天皇末期頃に藤原不比等に嫁ぎ、藤原武智麻呂、藤原房前、藤原宇合の三男を儲けた。
sen.e: Shoshi married to FUJIWARA no Fuhito around the end of time of Emperor Tenmu, and had three boys: FUJIWARA no Muchimaro, FUJIWARA no Fusasaki, and FUJIWARA no Umakai.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Shoshi married to FUJIWARA no Fuhito around the end of Emperor Tenmu's reign, and had three sons: FUJIWARA no Muchimaro, FUJIWARA no Fusasaki, and FUJIWARA no Umakai.
Shoshi married to FUJIWARA no Fuhito around the end of Emperor Tenmu's reign, and had three sons: FUJIWARA no Muchimaro, FUJIWARA no Fusasaki, and FUJIWARA no Umakai.

sen.j: （但し、宇合については武智麻呂、房前と生年が離れるため、疑問を呈する意見も根強い）。
sen.e: However, there are also those who argue tenaciously whether Umakai was her child or not because Umakai's year of birth was separated in age from Muchimaro and Fusasaki.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, there is a tenacious skepticism whether Umakai was truly her child as his birth was much later than Muchimaro's or Fusasaki's.
sen.cmt: 回りくどい言い回しでわかりづらいため訳し直し。

sen.j: 大宝 (日本)元年（701年）頃に不比等と再婚した県犬養三千代について『続日本紀』に「（不比等の）後妻」と書かれている。
sen.e: In "Shoku Nihonshoki" (Continuation of Chronicles of Japan), there is a description that AGATAINUKAI no Michiyo, to whom Fuhito married again around 701, was written as "(Fuhito's) second wife."
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: There is a description in "Shoku Nihonshoki" (Continuation of Chronicles of Japan)of AGATAINUKAI no Michiyo, as "(Fuhito's) second wife" that Fuhito got emarried with around 701.
sen.cmt: 回りくどい言い回しでわかりづらいため訳し直し。
sen.e: There is a description in "Shoku Nihonshoki" (Continuation of Chronicles of Japan)of AGATAINUKAI no Michiyo, as "(Fuhito's) second wife" that Fuhito got emarried with around 701.

sen.j: したがって、娼子は藤原不比等の最初の正室で大宝元年までには死去したことが分かる。
sen.e: Therefore, Shoshi was the first lawful wife of Fuhito and died before 701.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Shoshi was the first lawful wife of Fuhito and died before 701.
Shoshi was the first lawful wife of Fuhito and died before 701.

sen.j: しかし、『日本書紀』などの同時代史料には全く記載がないため、事績には不明の点が多い。
sen.e: However, Shoshi's deeds remain unknown because there are no descriptions about Shoshi in documents of the same age such as "Nihonshoki" (Chronicle of Japan).
However, there are no descriptions of Shoshi in documents of the same period such as "Nihonshoki" (Chronicle of Japan), and much of Shoshi's deeds remain unknown.

sen.j: 壬申の乱以後、蘇我氏は退潮が著しかった。
sen.e: The Soga clan declined significantly after the Jinshin War.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The Soga clan significantly declined in strength after the Jinshin War.
sen.cmt: 回りくどい言い回しでわかりづらいため訳し直し。
sen.e: The Soga clan significantly declined in strength after the Jinshin War.

sen.j: とはいえ、これまた当時没落豪族だったと推定される藤原不比等に嫁いだという状況から、彼女の周囲にも厳しい背景があったことが容易に推測できる。
sen.e: Imagine from her situation that she married to an impoverished Gozoku (local ruling family), she must faced difficult circumstances.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It is not hard to learn that she was given a harsh background that she had to marry FUJIWARA no Fuhito who was assumably a ruined Gozoku (local ruling family).
sen.cmt: 回りくどい言い回しでわかりづらいため訳し直し。
sen.e: It is not hard to learn that she was given a harsh background that she had to marry FUJIWARA no Fuhito who was assumably a ruined Gozoku (local ruling family).

sen.j: しかし、蘇我氏の血縁にあった持統天皇（大叔父蘇我倉山田石川麻呂の外孫にあたる）が即位するに及び、不比等が取り立てられたのには彼女の存在があったからと考えられている。
sen.e: However, when Emperor Jito, a family member of the Soga clan (his grandfather, SOGANOKURA-YAMADA no Ishikawamaro, was Shoshi's granduncle) was enthroned, Fuhito was selected because of Shoshi' presence.
However, when the Soga clan's blood related Emperor Jito (her grandfather, SOGANOKURA-YAMADA no Ishikawamaro, was Shoshi's granduncle) was enthroned, Fuhito was selected because of Shoshi' presence.
sen.cmt: family member → blood related持統天皇は女性である his → her(grandfather)
sen.e: However, when the Soga clan's blood related Emperor Jito (her grandfather, SOGANOKURA-YAMADA no Ishikawamaro, was Shoshi's granduncle) was enthroned, Fuhito was selected because of Shoshi' presence.

sen.j: また後年、藤原仲麻呂が石川年足を取り立てたのも彼女の血縁による物とされている。
sen.e: Also, FUJIWARA no Nakamaro selected ISHIKAWA no Toshitari because Toshitari was Shoshi's blood relative.
Also, it is thought that the reason why FUJIWARA no Nakamaro promoted ISHIKAWA no Toshitari was because he was Shoshi's blood relative.
sen.cmt: 回りくどい言い回しでわかりづらいため訳し直し。
sen.e: Also, it is thought that the reason why FUJIWARA no Nakamaro promoted ISHIKAWA no Toshitari was because he was Shoshi's blood relative.

sen.j: 結局、蘇我氏（石川氏）自体はその血を引いていた天武天皇の皇統断絶等もあって、姿を消す事となった。
sen.e: The Soga clan (the Ishikawa clan) eventually disappeared because of the extinction of Imperial line of Emperor Tenmu, who came from a long line of the Soga clan.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The Soga clan (the Ishikawa clan) eventually disappeared because of the extinction of Imperial line of Emperor Tenmu, who came from a long line of the Soga clan.
The Soga clan (the Ishikawa clan) eventually disappeared because of the extinction of Imperial line of Emperor Tenmu, who came from a long line of the Soga clan.

sen.j: その為、女系ながらも彼女が藤原氏を通して、その血統を現在まで伝える事となった。
sen.e: Shoshi left bloodline of the Soga clan through the Fujiwara clan from the maternal side of a family until now.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Which resulted Shoshi to have maternally kept the bloodline of the Soga clan through the Fujiwara clan until now.
sen.cmt: 回りくどい言い回しでわかりづらいため訳し直し。
sen.e: Which resulted Shoshi to have maternally kept the bloodline of the Soga clan through the Fujiwara clan until now.

sen.j: なお彼女の他に蘇我氏の血を天皇家に残したのは、時代を遡り蘇我稲目の娘である蘇我堅塩媛のみである。
sen.e: Women of the SOGA clan other than Shoshi who left their blood to the Imperial family was only SOGA no Kitashihime, a daughter of SOGA no Iname, tracing back through history.
Other than Shoshi, who left the SOGA clan's blood to the Imperial family was only SOGA no Kitashihime, SOGA no Inam's daughter, as tracking back the history.
sen.cmt: 回りくどい言い回しでわかりづらいため訳し直し。
sen.e: Other than Shoshi, who left the SOGA clan's blood to the Imperial family was only SOGA no Kitashihime, SOGA no Inam's daughter, as tracking back the history.

sen.j: その系統は蘇我堅塩媛―桜井皇子―吉備姫王―皇極天皇―天智天皇―今上天皇となる。
sen.e: The family line is: SOGA no Kitashihime, Sakurai no Miko, Kibitsuhime Okimi, Empress Kogyoku, Emperor Tenchi, and the present Emperor.
The family line is: SOGA no Kitashihime - Sakurai no Miko - Kibitsuhime Okimi - Empress Kogyoku - Emperor Tenchi - the present Emperor of Japan.
sen.cmt: 原語にある、「－」のままのほうが分かりやすいかと思われます。
sen.e: The family line is: SOGA no Kitashihime - Sakurai no Miko - Kibitsuhime Okimi - Empress Kogyoku - Emperor Tenchi - the present Emperor of Japan.
